location_analysis.climate_type: Type I (Two pronounced seasons: dry from November to April, wet during the rest of the year)

market_conditions.price_trends: Stable for bananas, pineapples, and mangoes. Papayas may see slight price increases due to seasonal demand.
local_market_saturation: Watermelons (can be oversupplied depending on the harvest)
Some leafy vegetables (check local market reports)

agricultural_calendar.optimal_planting_window: November-January (for many fruit trees and vegetables)
agricultural_calendar.harvest_season_conflict: Minimal conflict for most fruits planted now, but monitor weather forecasts closely for late-season typhoons that could impact late harvests.

pest_disease_season: Fruit flies (especially on mangoes and other fruits)
risk_factors.water_availability: Moderate (Quezon City relies on piped water; monitor supply during dry spells)
risk_factors.soil_degradation_risk: Moderate (Urban farming can lead to soil compaction and nutrient depletion if not managed properly. Soil testing and amendment are recommended.)
